content.title: Scheme for Grant of Additional Scholarship to the Students Belonging to Scheduled Tribes of Andaman and Nicobar Islands for Pursuing Higher Studies Anywhere in India Post-Senior Secondary Courses (Post 10+2 Courses)
content.department: Department of Tribal Welfare, Union Territory of Andaman and Nicobar Islands
content.beneficiary: Students belonging to Scheduled Tribes of Andaman and Nicobar Islands
content.details: The scheme aims to provide additional financial assistance (scholarship) to ST students pursuing higher education after Senior Secondary (12th Standard) in Colleges/Universities anywhere in India, as an incentive to supplement the cost of their education.
benefits: An amount of ₹1000/- per month shall be given to the eligible students.
The additional scholarship shall be payable for ten months in an academic session.
The additional scholarship money shall be directly released to the bank account of the beneficiaries.
eligibility: Students of Scheduled Tribes (STs) of Andaman and Nicobar Islands as notified by the President of India.
Students who have passed Senior Secondary (10+2) from a recognized Board or any higher examination from a recognized University.
Students pursuing recognized regular and full-time Post-Senior Secondary courses, Graduate/Post Graduate courses, Doctoral and Post-Doctoral courses.
exclusions: Students studying in Class XI or XII of the Higher Secondary School courses.
Students who, after passing one stage of education, are studying in the same stage of education in a different subject.
documents_required: Copy of marks statement duly counter-signed by the Head of the Institution for renewal of scholarship

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: To provide additional financial assistance (scholarship) to ST students pursuing higher education after Senior Secondary.

faqs.question: Which is the implementing department of this scheme?
faqs.answer: The Directorate of Tribal Welfare, Union Territory of Andaman and Nicobar Islands Administration.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Students belonging to Scheduled Tribes of Andaman and Nicobar Islands who have passed Senior Secondary (10+2).

faqs.question: What is the benefit of the scheme?
faqs.answer: An amount of ₹1000/- per month shall be given to the eligible students.

faqs.question: Is this scheme only for the students of Scheduled Tribes Category?
faqs.answer: Yes, the student should belong to the Scheduled Tribes Category.
